title: Get mesmerized with the magnificent beauty of the Pink city
text:
All one need to do here is choosing from the Jaipur travel packages and packing the bags straight away to enjoy the scenic beauty of the royal city. 
Jaipur the pink city is a majestic place and is often regarded as a jewel in the heart of Rajasthan. It is the city with several historic landmarks such as the city palace, Amer Fort, Nahargarh Fort, the Jantar Mantar, Hawa Mahal, Albert hall, Galtaji, Sargasuli and many more temples and places of interest. One could choose among the righteous Jaipur travel packages and visit all the majestic locations of historic importance. City Palace: 
The city palace is an extraordinarily carved historic monument with well designed marble columns and floral motifs, which stand as a marvel. The entrance bears the white elephants carved out of marble and now the palace is a museum exhibiting the items such as their dresses, swords, scabbards and more, used by the Royal families. Amer Fort: 
Amer served as a capital for the rulers and the fort is a complicated complex of magnificent palaces, halls, gardens and pavilions. The fort has extremely beautiful pillared halls and intricately carved screens, mirrors, stucco works and more. The fort offers a spectacular view of the city from its high palaces. Galtaji: 
An ancient pilgrim centre rich with temples, naturally developed lakes, and more. One can enjoy a serene landscape by making visits and by coming through Jaipur travel packages. Jantar Mantar: 
It is a remarkable observatory constructed out of stone and marble can represent the Medieval Indian astronomy. It is a must visit monument to understand the capability of Indians during the time immemorial. Hawa Mahal: 
A strikingly unique monument designed by Sawai Pratap Singh stands in its way as astonishment to todayâ€™s constructions. This is actually constructed to provide an advantage for the Royal women to have a complete yet careful watch of the processions. Gaitore: 
It is located on the Jaipur- Amber road and is a royal cemetery where all the cenotaphs are built in the chattri designs and eminent carvings.. Govind Devji temple: 
It is located in one of the gardens and contains in it an idol of lord Krishna. The temple bears a pleasant atmosphere and seems pleasing to all those visiting it. Ramgarh Lake: 
It is found 32 km north east to the city, and is one of the famous artificial water bodies in the city. It remains covered with hills and trees and still remains as a symbol i historic antiquity. The Hati Gaon Village: 
Near the Amber Palace of Jaipur is a cute little village called the Hathi Gaon, where the village remains as a housing project for elephants and their Mahouts. The habitat remains so natural provoking the stay of elephants. 
One could definitely relish, relax and get more pleasure visiting this royal city rich in forts and gardens constructed out of immense care and craftsmanship. The shopping in the pink city can introduce one to several artistic goods. Source:   ABOUT THE AUTHOR
